channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overgrown trees on lane blocking sunlight on allotment area, 18th September
item.description:
The trees on the lane outside of the school premises have reached an unacceptable height now so that they are totally blocking any sun reaching onto allotment area on the other side of fence.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitethorn Drive, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 18th September
item.description:
Customer reports that a mature tree at the location needs trimming back, as it is overhanging their drive. Branches and conkers are falling onto their vehicles; the conkers are a trip-hazard. Furthermore, tree sap is accumulating on their car.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown trees and grass, 18th September
item.description:
11 Bircher Way Hucclecote Gloucester GL3 3QW The trees have been hanging over the path down the side of our house making the paving green and slippy I'm disabled too so dangerous. Also the grass on the land next to the house has not been cut for a few years and is very overgrown and messy.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Buscombe Rise, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Branch over 2m down, either from wind or possibly due to refuse truck this morning. This is on a main school run route. The tree needs assessing for safety., 18th September
item.description:
1 Abbots Leys Road Winchcombe GL54 5QE. Cherry tree outside house. Sheds sizeable branches and overhangs property, path and road. Large branch down today. Tree needs assessing for danger, as is on a main school run route, so potential for injury if further branches fall. This branch is over 2m and fell this morning, but this has happened before.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbots Leys Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Path sinking, 18th September
item.description:
Since wales & west have replaced the gas pipes, a section of path outside mine and my neighbours homes, the path is sinking and in places raising up, very uneven. This has only happened in the last week We are concerned that it could collapse at any time

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pillcroft Close, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 18th September
item.description:
Customer reported that sign advertising the road closure which was situated on A38 outside the Odessa Pub, has disappeared since Monday. Motorists are now turning down the road, finding they can't get through and that it's difficult to turn around and giving the nursery staff abuse because of this. Please could a new sign be put on the A38 outside the Odessa Pub to avoid this.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lack of yellow box means all backed up traffic into Cheltenham on the A40 stops southbound traffic trying to pass through roundabout, 17th September
item.description:
Traffic backing up on A40 into Cheltenham is causing blockages on the roundabout for southbound traffic trying to exit Princess Elizabeth Way and get through onto the westbound A40. Every morning the same. Cars just back up at the eastbound A40 bottleneck without anywhere to go, and this causes unnecessary delays to the princess Elizabeth Way traffic trying to get out of Cheltenham. A simple yellow box to make enough room for the two lanes to get on and off the roundabout is desperately required. There’s no reason for it to be so log jammed because other road users can’t work out just how obstructive they are when not being able to exit the roundabout.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Benhall Roundabout, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Ambiguous Road markings after road layout change, 17th September
item.description:
Since road layout change at the Park and Ride Roundabout, road marking’s are ambiguous. If coming from KFC and heading to Costa/BMW, the road layout encourages people to still use left hand lane, when in fact it would be better to provide clarification and direct people into the right hand lane. Currently the road markings still say right hand lane for P&R only. Many road users are using both lanes and converging into the exit of the roundabout, which is causing lots of issues on a daily basis.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: I imagine travelling to space is more comfortable than driving along this road in a car., 17th September
item.description:
Isn’t it time the whole road is resurfaced? You can’t avoid them anymore. The next winter will make this road almost undriveable if you want to actually maintain the condition of your car. Is this going to be addressed? No one seems to want to acknowledge this so far despite raising it a few times now?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 141, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
